titleStmt.title: Huon d'Auvergne, Bibliteca del seminario vescovile MS 32 (P), Annotations

sourceDesc.msDesc:
target ? See Cummings 52 -->
Italy Bologna Biblioteca Comunale dell'Archiginnasio MS B. 3489

div.note: Editorial work in progress. Check back for updates.

Rubric 46] atrovent: "find, discover", from it. "trovare", cf. "attrovare" (TLIO) and "atrover" (RIALFri, Enfances Bovo, v. 931 passim); parasynthetic verbs, those adding a prefix, are characteristic of Franco-Itlaian, cf. Holtus-Wunderli (2005, 65).
1027] erent: lenition of double consonants typical to Northern dialects.
1028] e·mont: "in the world of the living", from OF "en + le".
1029] septe: latinism; virent: "they saw", lenition of the occlusive consonant d.
1029] a primer ] al primer; cf. B v. 9907.
1030] enstorie: "the account, story"; the epenthetic n is common in Franco-Italian texts, cf. Holtus (1979, 300); despont: "explain in detail", from OF "despondre", cf. FEW 3,98b.
1032] ensont: "up above", from OF "enson", cf. DEAF.

1033] gardes: "to look at", from Frankish "*wardôn", cf. FEW 17,510a; scont: "to hide, conceal", from Vul. Lat. "*scondere" < abscondere; OF "abscondre", cf. FEW 14,51a; possible latinism with hypercorrection, cf. DELI "ascondere".
1035] carere: possible double meaning, both "cattedra" or "via", cf. note to Berlin l. 9915; reont: "round", cf. FEW 10,520b.
1036] veos: "look" (imperative), cf. Berlin l. 9916.
1037] Q'el estrologie: "who in astrology", el from OF "en + el", cf. Berlin l. 9917.
1038] enpront: "ready, eager", cf. FEW 9.444.
1039] sali sunt: "are sullied, dirtied", passing from Frankish "*salo" to OF "salir", cf. FEW 17,13a.
1040] mani e front: "hands and forehead", cf. Il Novellino, Chap. 29 and the note to Br l. 1096; pont: "the reason, point', cf. FEW 9,586a.
1044] angles: "angels", cf. Holtus-Wunderli (2005, 63); the RIALFrI database reveals that the form is frequent in Franco-Italian texts
1047] joste: "next to", OF "joste", cf.FEW5,96b.
1049] Nen on posança: "they are not able"; lit. "they do not have the power, ability".
1050] tençer: "to debate", OF "tenser', cf.FEW13/1,225a; frequent in the RIALFrI database.
1051] desputere: reference to the scholasttic pedagogical method "disputatio".
1053] arsmisache: corrupt reading? Likely refers to arithmatic, one of four disciplines of the quadrivium, which, together with the trivium, form the seven liberl arts.
1054] âsoager: "to calm, pacify", OF "suajier", cf.FEW12,324b; here and at l. 1056 the preposition elides with the initial vowel of the verb.

1055] roches: "che ha la voce arrochita, abbassata, fioca [...] per i continui lamenti, per l'ira, per un'emozione, per il pianto", GDLI 17,16b; cf. IT "fiacco" (< FLACCUS), Inf., 1.63: "chi per lungo silenzio parea fioco"; no val un dener: 'not worth anything', recurring formula in OF epic.
1056] quens: "count", OF "quens", cf.FEW2/2,940b; frequent in, for example, the Entrée, cf. RIALFrI; âstorner: "tourmenter, bouleverser', from the Frankish "*sturm", cf. Holtus Lexikalische, p. 317.
1061] ovres: "orations, prayers".
1062] acostumer: "to grow accustomed to"; cf. Par., 8.142, "E se 'l mondo là giù ponesse mente / al fondamento che natura pone".

1063] aremenbrer: "to remember"; another instance of a parasynthetic verb (cf. note R46); cf. "arecorder", P l. 4705, the Bovo d'Antona laurenziana, 1. 321 passim; and Aquilon de Bavière, 6.VI.20 passim. Both texts are available on RIALFrI.
1065] lor: "then", cf. IT "allora".
